        <span class="property-indicator"></span>
        <span class="property-type"><a href="#supplementalgroupsstrategyoptions">Supplemental<wbr>Groups<wbr>Strategy<wbr>Options</a></span>
    </dt>
    <dd><p>supplementalGroups is the strategy that will dictate what supplemental groups are used by the SecurityContext.</p>
</dd><dt class="property-optional"
            title="Optional">
        <span id="allowprivilegeescalation_java">
<a data-swiftype-name="resource-property" data-swiftype-type="text" href="#allowprivilegeescalation_java" style="color: inherit; text-decoration: inherit;">allow<wbr>Privilege<wbr>Escalation</a>
</span>
        <span class="property-indicator"></span>
        <span class="property-type">Boolean</span>
    </dt>
    <dd><p>allowPrivilegeEscalation determines if a pod can request to allow privilege escalation. If unspecified, defaults to true.</p>
</dd><dt class="property-optional"
            title="Optional">
        <span id="allowedcsidrivers_java">
<a data-swiftype-name="resource-property" data-swiftype-type="text" href="#allowedcsidrivers_java" style="color: inherit; text-decoration: inherit;">allowed<wbr>CSIDrivers</a>
</span>
        <span class="property-indicator"></span>
        <span class="property-type"><a href="#allowedcsidriver">List<Allowed<wbr>CSIDriver></a></span>
    </dt>
    <dd><p>AllowedCSIDrivers is a whitelist of inline CSI drivers that must be explicitly set to be embedded within a pod spec. An empty value indicates that any CSI driver can be used for inline ephemeral volumes.</p>
</dd><dt class="property-optional"
            title="Optional">
        <span id="allowedcapabilities_java">
<a data-swiftype-name="resource-property" data-swiftype-type="text" href="#allowedcapabilities_java" style="color: inherit; text-decoration: inherit;">allowed<wbr>Capabilities</a>
</span>
        <span class="property-indicator"></span>
        <span class="property-type">List<String></span>
    </dt>
    <dd><p>allowedCapabilities is a list of capabilities that can be requested to add to the container. Capabilities in this field may be added at the pod author's discretion. You must not list a capability in both allowedCapabilities and requiredDropCapabilities.</p>
</dd><dt class="property-optional"
            title="Optional">
        <span id="allowedflexvolumes_java">
<a data-swiftype-name="resource-property" data-swiftype-type="text" href="#allowedflexvolumes_java" style="color: inherit; text-decoration: inherit;">allowed<wbr>Flex<wbr>Volumes</a>
</span>
        <span class="property-indicator"></span>
        <span class="property-type"><a href="#allowedflexvolume">List<Allowed<wbr>Flex<wbr>Volume></a></span>
    </dt>
    <dd><p>allowedFlexVolumes is a whitelist of allowed Flexvolumes.  Empty or nil indicates that all Flexvolumes may be used.  This parameter is effective only when the usage of the Flexvolumes is allowed in the &quot;volumes&quot; field.</p>
</dd><dt class="property-optional"
            title="Optional">
        <span id="allowedhostpaths_java">
<a data-swiftype-name="resource-property" data-swiftype-type="text" href="#allowedhostpaths_java" style="color: inherit; text-decoration: inherit;">allowed<wbr>Host<wbr>Paths</a>
</span>
        <span class="property-indicator"></span>
        <span class="property-type"><a href="#allowedhostpath">List<Allowed<wbr>Host<wbr>Path></a></span>
    </dt>
    <dd><p>allowedHostPaths is a white list of allowed host paths. Empty indicates that all host paths may be used.</p>
</dd><dt class="property-optional"
            title="Optional">
        <span id="allowedprocmounttypes_java">
<a data-swiftype-name="resource-property" data-swiftype-type="text" href="#allowedprocmounttypes_java" style="color: inherit; text-decoration: inherit;">allowed<wbr>Proc<wbr>Mount<wbr>Types</a>
</span>
        <span class="property-indicator"></span>
        <span class="property-type">List<String></span>
    </dt>
    <dd><p>AllowedProcMountTypes is a whitelist of allowed ProcMountTypes. Empty or nil indicates that only the DefaultProcMountType may be used. This requires the ProcMountType feature flag to be enabled.</p>
</dd><dt class="property-optional"
            title="Optional">
        <span id="allowedunsafesysctls_java">
<a data-swiftype-name="resource-property" data-swiftype-type="text" href="#allowedunsafesysctls_java" style="color: inherit; text-decoration: inherit;">allowed<wbr>Unsafe<wbr>Sysctls</a>
</span>
        <span class="property-indicator"></span>
        <span class="property-type">List<String></span>
    </dt>
    <dd><p>allowedUnsafeSysctls is a list of explicitly allowed unsafe sysctls, defaults to none. Each entry is either a plain sysctl name or ends in &quot;*&quot; in which case it is considered as a prefix of allowed sysctls. Single * means all unsafe sysctls are allowed. Kubelet has to whitelist all allowed unsafe sysctls explicitly to avoid rejection.</p>
<p>Examples: e.g. &quot;foo/<em>&quot; allows &quot;foo/bar&quot;, &quot;foo/baz&quot;, etc. e.g. &quot;foo.</em>&quot; allows &quot;foo.bar&quot;, &quot;foo.baz&quot;, etc.</p>
</dd><dt class="property-optional"
            title="Optional">
        <span id="defaultaddcapabilities_java">
<a data-swiftype-name="resource-property" data-swiftype-type="text" href="#defaultaddcapabilities_java" style="color: inherit; text-decoration: inherit;">default<wbr>Add<wbr>Capabilities</a>
</span>
        <span class="property-indicator"></span>
        <span class="property-type">List<String></span>
    </dt>
    <dd><p>defaultAddCapabilities is the default set of capabilities that will be added to the container unless the pod spec specifically drops the capability.  You may not list a capability in both defaultAddCapabilities and requiredDropCapabilities. Capabilities added here are implicitly allowed, and need not be included in the allowedCapabilities list.</p>
</dd><dt class="property-optional"
            title="Optional">
        <span id="defaultallowprivilegeescalation_java">
<a data-swiftype-name="resource-property" data-swiftype-type="text" href="#defaultallowprivilegeescalation_java" style="color: inherit; text-decoration: inherit;">default<wbr>Allow<wbr>Privilege<wbr>Escalation</a>
</span>
        <span class="property-indicator"></span>
        <span class="property-type">Boolean</span>
    </dt>
    <dd><p>defaultAllowPrivilegeEscalation controls the default setting for whether a process can gain more privileges than its parent process.</p>
</dd><dt class="property-optional"
            title="Optional">
        <span id="forbiddensysctls_java">
<a data-swiftype-name="resource-property" data-swiftype-type="text" href="#forbiddensysctls_java" style="color: inherit; text-decoration: inherit;">forbidden<wbr>Sysctls</a>
</span>
        <span class="property-indicator"></span>
        <span class="property-type">List<String></span>
    </dt>
    <dd><p>forbiddenSysctls is a list of explicitly forbidden sysctls, defaults to none. Each entry is either a plain sysctl name or ends in &quot;*&quot; in which case it is considered as a prefix of forbidden sysctls. Single * means all sysctls are forbidden.</p>
<p>Examples: e.g. &quot;foo/<em>&quot; forbids &quot;foo/bar&quot;, &quot;foo/baz&quot;, etc. e.g. &quot;foo.</em>&quot; forbids &quot;foo.bar&quot;, &quot;foo.baz&quot;, etc.</p>
</dd><dt class="property-optional"
            title="Optional">
        <span id="hostipc_java">

</dd><dt class="property-optional"
            title="Optional">

            title="Optional">

        <span class="property-type">Boolean</span>
    </dt>

</dd><dt class="property-optional"
            title="Optional">
        <span id="hostports_java">

        <span class="property-indicator"></span>

        <span id="readonlyrootfilesystem_java">

</span>
        <span class="property-indicator"></span>
        <span class="property-type">Boolean</span>
    </dt>
    <dd><p>readOnlyRootFilesystem when set to true will force containers to run with a read only root file system.  If the container specifically requests to run with a non-read only root file system the PSP should deny the pod. If set to false the container may run with a read only root file system if it wishes but it will not be forced to.</p>
</dd><dt class="property-optional"

        <span class="property-indicator"></span>
        <span class="property-type">List<String></span>
    </dt>
    <dd><p>requiredDropCapabilities are the capabilities that will be dropped from the container.  These are required to be dropped and cannot be added.</p>
</dd><dt class="property-optional"
            title="Optional">
        <span id="runasgroup_java">
<a data-swiftype-name="resource-property" data-swiftype-type="text" href="#runasgroup_java" style="color: inherit; text-decoration: inherit;">run<wbr>As<wbr>Group</a>
</span>
        <span class="property-indicator"></span>
        <span class="property-type"><a href="#runasgroupstrategyoptions">Run<wbr>As<wbr>Group<wbr>Strategy<wbr>Options</a></span>

    <dd><p>RunAsGroup is the strategy that will dictate the allowable RunAsGroup values that may be set. If this field is omitted, the pod's RunAsGroup can take any value. This field requires the RunAsGroup feature gate to be enabled.</p>

            title="Optional">

            title="Optional">
        <span id="volumes_java">

        <span class="property-type">string[]</span>
    </dt>
    <dd><p>defaultAddCapabilities is the default set of capabilities that will be added to the container unless the pod spec specifically drops the capability.  You may not list a capability in both defaultAddCapabilities and requiredDropCapabilities. Capabilities added here are implicitly allowed, and need not be included in the allowedCapabilities list.</p>
</dd><dt class="property-optional"
            title="Optional">
        <span id="defaultallowprivilegeescalation_nodejs">
<a data-swiftype-name="resource-property" data-swiftype-type="text" href="#defaultallowprivilegeescalation_nodejs" style="color: inherit; text-decoration: inherit;">default<wbr>Allow<wbr>Privilege<wbr>Escalation</a>
</span>
        <span class="property-indicator"></span>
        <span class="property-type">boolean</span>
    </dt>
    <dd><p>defaultAllowPrivilegeEscalation controls the default setting for whether a process can gain more privileges than its parent process.</p>
</dd><dt class="property-optional"
            title="Optional">
        <span id="forbiddensysctls_nodejs">
<a data-swiftype-name="resource-property" data-swiftype-type="text" href="#forbiddensysctls_nodejs" style="color: inherit; text-decoration: inherit;">forbidden<wbr>Sysctls</a>
</span>
        <span class="property-indicator"></span>
        <span class="property-type">string[]</span>
    </dt>
    <dd><p>forbiddenSysctls is a list of explicitly forbidden sysctls, defaults to none. Each entry is either a plain sysctl name or ends in &quot;*&quot; in which case it is considered as a prefix of forbidden sysctls. Single * means all sysctls are forbidden.</p>
<p>Examples: e.g. &quot;foo/<em>&quot; forbids &quot;foo/bar&quot;, &quot;foo/baz&quot;, etc. e.g. &quot;foo.</em>&quot; forbids &quot;foo.bar&quot;, &quot;foo.baz&quot;, etc.</p>
</dd><dt class="property-optional"
            title="Optional">
        <span id="hostipc_nodejs">
<a data-swiftype-name="resource-property" data-swiftype-type="text" href="#hostipc_nodejs" style="color: inherit; text-decoration: inherit;">host<wbr>IPC</a>
</span>
        <span class="property-indicator"></span>
        <span class="property-type">boolean</span>
    </dt>
    <dd><p>hostIPC determines if the policy allows the use of HostIPC in the pod spec.</p>
</dd><dt class="property-optional"
            title="Optional">
        <span id="hostnetwork_nodejs">
<a data-swiftype-name="resource-property" data-swiftype-type="text" href="#hostnetwork_nodejs" style="color: inherit; text-decoration: inherit;">host<wbr>Network</a>
</span>
        <span class="property-indicator"></span>
        <span class="property-type">boolean</span>
    </dt>
    <dd><p>hostNetwork determines if the policy allows the use of HostNetwork in the pod spec.</p>
</dd><dt class="property-optional"
            title="Optional">
        <span id="hostpid_nodejs">
<a data-swiftype-name="resource-property" data-swiftype-type="text" href="#hostpid_nodejs" style="color: inherit; text-decoration: inherit;">host<wbr>PID</a>
</span>
        <span class="property-indicator"></span>
        <span class="property-type">boolean</span>
    </dt>
    <dd><p>hostPID determines if the policy allows the use of HostPID in the pod spec.</p>
</dd><dt class="property-optional"
            title="Optional">
        <span id="hostports_nodejs">
<a data-swiftype-name="resource-property" data-swiftype-type="text" href="#hostports_nodejs" style="color: inherit; text-decoration: inherit;">host<wbr>Ports</a>
</span>
        <span class="property-indicator"></span>
        <span class="property-type"><a href="#hostportrange">Host<wbr>Port<wbr>Range[]</a></span>
    </dt>
    <dd><p>hostPorts determines which host port ranges are allowed to be exposed.</p>
</dd><dt class="property-optional"
            title="Optional">
        <span id="privileged_nodejs">
<a data-swiftype-name="resource-property" data-swiftype-type="text" href="#privileged_nodejs" style="color: inherit; text-decoration: inherit;">privileged</a>
</span>
        <span class="property-indicator"></span>
        <span class="property-type">boolean</span>
    </dt>
    <dd><p>privileged determines if a pod can request to be run as privileged.</p>
</dd><dt class="property-optional"
            title="Optional">
        <span id="readonlyrootfilesystem_nodejs">
<a data-swiftype-name="resource-property" data-swiftype-type="text" href="#readonlyrootfilesystem_nodejs" style="color: inherit; text-decoration: inherit;">read<wbr>Only<wbr>Root<wbr>Filesystem</a>
</span>
        <span class="property-indicator"></span>
        <span class="property-type">boolean</span>
    </dt>
    <dd><p>readOnlyRootFilesystem when set to true will force containers to run with a read only root file system.  If the container specifically requests to run with a non-read only root file system the PSP should deny the pod. If set to false the container may run with a read only root file system if it wishes but it will not be forced to.</p>
</dd><dt class="property-optional"
            title="Optional">
        <span id="requireddropcapabilities_nodejs">
<a data-swiftype-name="resource-property" data-swiftype-type="text" href="#requireddropcapabilities_nodejs" style="color: inherit; text-decoration: inherit;">required<wbr>Drop<wbr>Capabilities</a>
</span>
        <span class="property-indicator"></span>
        <span class="property-type">string[]</span>
    </dt>
    <dd><p>requiredDropCapabilities are the capabilities that will be dropped from the container.  These are required to be dropped and cannot be added.</p>
</dd><dt class="property-optional"
            title="Optional">
        <span id="runasgroup_nodejs">
<a data-swiftype-name="resource-property" data-swiftype-type="text" href="#runasgroup_nodejs" style="color: inherit; text-decoration: inherit;">run<wbr>As<wbr>Group</a>
</span>
        <span class="property-indicator"></span>
        <span class="property-type"><a href="#runasgroupstrategyoptions">Run<wbr>As<wbr>Group<wbr>Strategy<wbr>Options</a></span>
    </dt>
    <dd><p>RunAsGroup is the strategy that will dictate the allowable RunAsGroup values that may be set. If this field is omitted, the pod's RunAsGroup can take any value. This field requires the RunAsGroup feature gate to be enabled.</p>
</dd><dt class="property-optional"
            title="Optional">
        <span id="runtimeclass_nodejs">
<a data-swiftype-name="resource-property" data-swiftype-type="text" href="#runtimeclass_nodejs" style="color: inherit; text-decoration: inherit;">runtime<wbr>Class</a>
</span>
        <span class="property-indicator"></span>
        <span class="property-type"><a href="#runtimeclassstrategyoptions">Runtime<wbr>Class<wbr>Strategy<wbr>Options</a></span>
    </dt>
    <dd><p>runtimeClass is the strategy that will dictate the allowable RuntimeClasses for a pod. If this field is omitted, the pod's runtimeClassName field is unrestricted. Enforcement of this field depends on the RuntimeClass feature gate being enabled.</p>
</dd><dt class="property-optional"
            title="Optional">
        <span id="volumes_nodejs">
<a data-swiftype-name="resource-property" data-swiftype-type="text" href="#volumes_nodejs" style="color: inherit; text-decoration: inherit;">volumes</a>
</span>
        <span class="property-indicator"></span>
        <span class="property-type">string[]</span>
    </dt>
    <dd><p>volumes is a white list of allowed volume plugins. Empty indicates that no volumes may be used. To allow all volumes you may use '*'.</p>
</dd></dl>
</pulumi-choosable>
</div>

    <dd><p>allowedFlexVolumes is a whitelist of allowed Flexvolumes.  Empty or nil indicates that all Flexvolumes may be used.  This parameter is effective only when the usage of the Flexvolumes is allowed in the &quot;volumes&quot; field.</p>
</dd><dt class="property-optional"

</dd><dt class="property-optional"
            title="Optional">
        <span id="allowed_unsafe_sysctls_python">
<a data-swiftype-name="resource-property" data-swiftype-type="text" href="#allowed_unsafe_sysctls_python" style="color: inherit; text-decoration: inherit;">allowed_<wbr>unsafe_<wbr>sysctls</a>
</span>
        <span class="property-indicator"></span>
        <span class="property-type">Sequence[str]</span>
    </dt>
    <dd><p>allowedUnsafeSysctls is a list of explicitly allowed unsafe sysctls, defaults to none. Each entry is either a plain sysctl name or ends in &quot;*&quot; in which case it is considered as a prefix of allowed sysctls. Single * means all unsafe sysctls are allowed. Kubelet has to whitelist all allowed unsafe sysctls explicitly to avoid rejection.</p>
<p>Examples: e.g. &quot;foo/<em>&quot; allows &quot;foo/bar&quot;, &quot;foo/baz&quot;, etc. e.g. &quot;foo.</em>&quot; allows &quot;foo.bar&quot;, &quot;foo.baz&quot;, etc.</p>

            title="Optional">
        <span id="allowedcsidrivers_yaml">
<a data-swiftype-name="resource-property" data-swiftype-type="text" href="#allowedcsidrivers_yaml" style="color: inherit; text-decoration: inherit;">allowed<wbr>CSIDrivers</a>
</span>
        <span class="property-indicator"></span>
        <span class="property-type"><a href="#allowedcsidriver">List<Property Map></a></span>
    </dt>
    <dd><p>AllowedCSIDrivers is a whitelist of inline CSI drivers that must be explicitly set to be embedded within a pod spec. An empty value indicates that any CSI driver can be used for inline ephemeral volumes.</p>
</dd><dt class="property-optional"
            title="Optional">
        <span id="allowedcapabilities_yaml">
<a data-swiftype-name="resource-property" data-swiftype-type="text" href="#allowedcapabilities_yaml" style="color: inherit; text-decoration: inherit;">allowed<wbr>Capabilities</a>
</span>
        <span class="property-indicator"></span>
        <span class="property-type">List<String></span>
    </dt>
    <dd><p>allowedCapabilities is a list of capabilities that can be requested to add to the container. Capabilities in this field may be added at the pod author's discretion. You must not list a capability in both allowedCapabilities and requiredDropCapabilities.</p>
</dd><dt class="property-optional"
            title="Optional">
        <span id="allowedflexvolumes_yaml">
<a data-swiftype-name="resource-property" data-swiftype-type="text" href="#allowedflexvolumes_yaml" style="color: inherit; text-decoration: inherit;">allowed<wbr>Flex<wbr>Volumes</a>
</span>
        <span class="property-indicator"></span>
        <span class="property-type"><a href="#allowedflexvolume">List<Property Map></a></span>
    </dt>
    <dd><p>allowedFlexVolumes is a whitelist of allowed Flexvolumes.  Empty or nil indicates that all Flexvolumes may be used.  This parameter is effective only when the usage of the Flexvolumes is allowed in the &quot;volumes&quot; field.</p>
</dd><dt class="property-optional"
            title="Optional">
        <span id="allowedhostpaths_yaml">
<a data-swiftype-name="resource-property" data-swiftype-type="text" href="#allowedhostpaths_yaml" style="color: inherit; text-decoration: inherit;">allowed<wbr>Host<wbr>Paths</a>
</span>
        <span class="property-indicator"></span>
        <span class="property-type"><a href="#allowedhostpath">List<Property Map></a></span>
    </dt>
    <dd><p>allowedHostPaths is a white list of allowed host paths. Empty indicates that all host paths may be used.</p>
</dd><dt class="property-optional"
            title="Optional">
        <span id="allowedprocmounttypes_yaml">
<a data-swiftype-name="resource-property" data-swiftype-type="text" href="#allowedprocmounttypes_yaml" style="color: inherit; text-decoration: inherit;">allowed<wbr>Proc<wbr>Mount<wbr>Types</a>
</span>
        <span class="property-indicator"></span>
        <span class="property-type">List<String></span>
    </dt>
    <dd><p>AllowedProcMountTypes is a whitelist of allowed ProcMountTypes. Empty or nil indicates that only the DefaultProcMountType may be used. This requires the ProcMountType feature flag to be enabled.</p>
</dd><dt class="property-optional"
            title="Optional">
        <span id="allowedunsafesysctls_yaml">
<a data-swiftype-name="resource-property" data-swiftype-type="text" href="#allowedunsafesysctls_yaml" style="color: inherit; text-decoration: inherit;">allowed<wbr>Unsafe<wbr>Sysctls</a>
</span>
        <span class="property-indicator"></span>
        <span class="property-type">List<String></span>
    </dt>
    <dd><p>allowedUnsafeSysctls is a list of explicitly allowed unsafe sysctls, defaults to none. Each entry is either a plain sysctl name or ends in &quot;*&quot; in which case it is considered as a prefix of allowed sysctls. Single * means all unsafe sysctls are allowed. Kubelet has to whitelist all allowed unsafe sysctls explicitly to avoid rejection.</p>
<p>Examples: e.g. &quot;foo/<em>&quot; allows &quot;foo/bar&quot;, &quot;foo/baz&quot;, etc. e.g. &quot;foo.</em>&quot; allows &quot;foo.bar&quot;, &quot;foo.baz&quot;, etc.</p>
</dd><dt class="property-optional"
            title="Optional">
        <span id="defaultaddcapabilities_yaml">
<a data-swiftype-name="resource-property" data-swiftype-type="text" href="#defaultaddcapabilities_yaml" style="color: inherit; text-decoration: inherit;">default<wbr>Add<wbr>Capabilities</a>
</span>
        <span class="property-indicator"></span>
        <span class="property-type">List<String></span>
    </dt>
    <dd><p>defaultAddCapabilities is the default set of capabilities that will be added to the container unless the pod spec specifically drops the capability.  You may not list a capability in both defaultAddCapabilities and requiredDropCapabilities. Capabilities added here are implicitly allowed, and need not be included in the allowedCapabilities list.</p>
</dd><dt class="property-optional"
            title="Optional">
        <span id="defaultallowprivilegeescalation_yaml">
<a data-swiftype-name="resource-property" data-swiftype-type="text" href="#defaultallowprivilegeescalation_yaml" style="color: inherit; text-decoration: inherit;">default<wbr>Allow<wbr>Privilege<wbr>Escalation</a>
</span>
        <span class="property-indicator"></span>
        <span class="property-type">Boolean</span>
    </dt>
    <dd><p>defaultAllowPrivilegeEscalation controls the default setting for whether a process can gain more privileges than its parent process.</p>
</dd><dt class="property-optional"
            title="Optional">
        <span id="forbiddensysctls_yaml">
<a data-swiftype-name="resource-property" data-swiftype-type="text" href="#forbiddensysctls_yaml" style="color: inherit; text-decoration: inherit;">forbidden<wbr>Sysctls</a>
</span>
        <span class="property-indicator"></span>
        <span class="property-type">List<String></span>
    </dt>
    <dd><p>forbiddenSysctls is a list of explicitly forbidden sysctls, defaults to none. Each entry is either a plain sysctl name or ends in &quot;*&quot; in which case it is considered as a prefix of forbidden sysctls. Single * means all sysctls are forbidden.</p>
<p>Examples: e.g. &quot;foo/<em>&quot; forbids &quot;foo/bar&quot;, &quot;foo/baz&quot;, etc. e.g. &quot;foo.</em>&quot; forbids &quot;foo.bar&quot;, &quot;foo.baz&quot;, etc.</p>
</dd><dt class="property-optional"
            title="Optional">
        <span id="hostipc_yaml">
<a data-swiftype-name="resource-property" data-swiftype-type="text" href="#hostipc_yaml" style="color: inherit; text-decoration: inherit;">host<wbr>IPC</a>
</span>
        <span class="property-indicator"></span>
        <span class="property-type">Boolean</span>
    </dt>
    <dd><p>hostIPC determines if the policy allows the use of HostIPC in the pod spec.</p>
</dd><dt class="property-optional"
            title="Optional">
        <span id="hostnetwork_yaml">
<a data-swiftype-name="resource-property" data-swiftype-type="text" href="#hostnetwork_yaml" style="color: inherit; text-decoration: inherit;">host<wbr>Network</a>
</span>
        <span class="property-indicator"></span>
        <span class="property-type">Boolean</span>
    </dt>
    <dd><p>hostNetwork determines if the policy allows the use of HostNetwork in the pod spec.</p>
</dd><dt class="property-optional"
            title="Optional">
        <span id="hostpid_yaml">
<a data-swiftype-name="resource-property" data-swiftype-type="text" href="#hostpid_yaml" style="color: inherit; text-decoration: inherit;">host<wbr>PID</a>
</span>
        <span class="property-indicator"></span>
        <span class="property-type">Boolean</span>
    </dt>
    <dd><p>hostPID determines if the policy allows the use of HostPID in the pod spec.</p>
</dd><dt class="property-optional"
            title="Optional">
        <span id="hostports_yaml">
<a data-swiftype-name="resource-property" data-swiftype-type="text" href="#hostports_yaml" style="color: inherit; text-decoration: inherit;">host<wbr>Ports</a>
</span>
        <span class="property-indicator"></span>
        <span class="property-type"><a href="#hostportrange">List<Property Map></a></span>
    </dt>
    <dd><p>hostPorts determines which host port ranges are allowed to be exposed.</p>
</dd><dt class="property-optional"
            title="Optional">
        <span id="privileged_yaml">
<a data-swiftype-name="resource-property" data-swiftype-type="text" href="#privileged_yaml" style="color: inherit; text-decoration: inherit;">privileged</a>
</span>
        <span class="property-indicator"></span>
        <span class="property-type">Boolean</span>
    </dt>
    <dd><p>privileged determines if a pod can request to be run as privileged.</p>
</dd><dt class="property-optional"
            title="Optional">
        <span id="readonlyrootfilesystem_yaml">
<a data-swiftype-name="resource-property" data-swiftype-type="text" href="#readonlyrootfilesystem_yaml" style="color: inherit; text-decoration: inherit;">read<wbr>Only<wbr>Root<wbr>Filesystem</a>
</span>
        <span class="property-indicator"></span>
        <span class="property-type">Boolean</span>
    </dt>
    <dd><p>readOnlyRootFilesystem when set to true will force containers to run with a read only root file system.  If the container specifically requests to run with a non-read only root file system the PSP should deny the pod. If set to false the container may run with a read only root file system if it wishes but it will not be forced to.</p>
</dd><dt class="property-optional"
            title="Optional">
        <span id="requireddropcapabilities_yaml">
<a data-swiftype-name="resource-property" data-swiftype-type="text" href="#requireddropcapabilities_yaml" style="color: inherit; text-decoration: inherit;">required<wbr>Drop<wbr>Capabilities</a>
</span>
        <span class="property-indicator"></span>
        <span class="property-type">List<String></span>
    </dt>
    <dd><p>requiredDropCapabilities are the capabilities that will be dropped from the container.  These are required to be dropped and cannot be added.</p>
</dd><dt class="property-optional"
            title="Optional">
        <span id="runasgroup_yaml">
<a data-swiftype-name="resource-property" data-swiftype-type="text" href="#runasgroup_yaml" style="color: inherit; text-decoration: inherit;">run<wbr>As<wbr>Group</a>
</span>
        <span class="property-indicator"></span>
        <span class="property-type"><a href="#runasgroupstrategyoptions">Property Map</a></span>
    </dt>
    <dd><p>RunAsGroup is the strategy that will dictate the allowable RunAsGroup values that may be set. If this field is omitted, the pod's RunAsGroup can take any value. This field requires the RunAsGroup feature gate to be enabled.</p>
</dd><dt class="property-optional"
            title="Optional">
        <span id="runtimeclass_yaml">
<a data-swiftype-name="resource-property" data-swiftype-type="text" href="#runtimeclass_yaml" style="color: inherit; text-decoration: inherit;">runtime<wbr>Class</a>
</span>
        <span class="property-indicator"></span>
        <span class="property-type"><a href="#runtimeclassstrategyoptions">Property Map</a></span>
    </dt>
    <dd><p>runtimeClass is the strategy that will dictate the allowable RuntimeClasses for a pod. If this field is omitted, the pod's runtimeClassName field is unrestricted. Enforcement of this field depends on the RuntimeClass feature gate being enabled.</p>
</dd><dt class="property-optional"
            title="Optional">
        <span id="volumes_yaml">
<a data-swiftype-name="resource-property" data-swiftype-type="text" href="#volumes_yaml" style="color: inherit; text-decoration: inherit;">volumes</a>
</span>
        <span class="property-indicator"></span>
        <span class="property-type">List<String></span>
    </dt>
    <dd><p>volumes is a white list of allowed volume plugins. Empty indicates that no volumes may be used. To allow all volumes you may use '*'.</p>
</dd></dl>
</pulumi-choosable>
</div>

<a data-swiftype-name="resource-property" data-swiftype-type="text" href="#rule_yaml" style="color: inherit; text-decoration: inherit;">rule</a>

        <span class="property-indicator"></span>
        <span class="property-type">String</span>
    </dt>
    <dd><p>rule is the strategy that will dictate the allowable RunAsUser values that may be set.</p>
</dd><dt class="property-optional"
            title="Optional">
        <span id="ranges_yaml">
<a data-swiftype-name="resource-property" data-swiftype-type="text" href="#ranges_yaml" style="color: inherit; text-decoration: inherit;">ranges</a>
</span>
        <span class="property-indicator"></span>
        <span class="property-type"><a href="#idrange">List<Property Map></a></span>
    </dt>
    <dd><p>ranges are the allowed ranges of uids that may be used. If you would like to force a single uid then supply a single range with the same start and end. Required for MustRunAs.</p>
</dd></dl>
</pulumi-choosable>
</div>

<h4 id="runtimeclassstrategyoptions">Runtime<wbr>Class<wbr>Strategy<wbr>Options</h4>

<div>
<pulumi-choosable type="language" values="csharp">
<dl class="resources-properties"><dt class="property-required"
            title="Required">
        <span id="allowedruntimeclassnames_csharp">
<a data-swiftype-name="resource-property" data-swiftype-type="text" href="#allowedruntimeclassnames_csharp" style="color: inherit; text-decoration: inherit;">Allowed<wbr>Runtime<wbr>Class<wbr>Names</a>
</span>
        <span class="property-indicator"></span>
        <span class="property-type">List&lt;string&gt;</span>
    </dt>
    <dd><p>allowedRuntimeClassNames is a whitelist of RuntimeClass names that may be specified on a pod. A value of &quot;*&quot; means that any RuntimeClass name is allowed, and must be the only item in the list. An empty list requires the RuntimeClassName field to be unset.</p>
</dd><dt class="property-optional"
            title="Optional">
        <span id="defaultruntimeclassname_csharp">
<a data-swiftype-name="resource-property" data-swiftype-type="text" href="#defaultruntimeclassname_csharp" style="color: inherit; text-decoration: inherit;">Default<wbr>Runtime<wbr>Class<wbr>Name</a>
</span>
        <span class="property-indicator"></span>
        <span class="property-type">string</span>
    </dt>
    <dd><p>defaultRuntimeClassName is the default RuntimeClassName to set on the pod. The default MUST be allowed by the allowedRuntimeClassNames list. A value of nil does not mutate the Pod.</p>
</dd></dl>
</pulumi-choosable>
</div>

<h4 id="supplementalgroupsstrategyoptions">Supplemental<wbr>Groups<wbr>Strategy<wbr>Options</h4>

<div>
<pulumi-choosable type="language" values="csharp">
<dl class="resources-properties"><dt class="property-optional"
            title="Optional">
        <span id="ranges_csharp">
<a data-swiftype-name="resource-property" data-swiftype-type="text" href="#ranges_csharp" style="color: inherit; text-decoration: inherit;">Ranges</a>
</span>
        <span class="property-indicator"></span>
        <span class="property-type"><a href="#idrange">List&lt;IDRange&gt;</a></span>
    </dt>
    <dd><p>ranges are the allowed ranges of supplemental groups.  If you would like to force a single supplemental group then supply a single range with the same start and end. Required for MustRunAs.</p>
</dd><dt class="property-optional"
            title="Optional">
        <span id="rule_csharp">
